hc4FcL3cdt0I_IvrDMhp2A.review_text: A nice, chill option in the neighborhood.  Strong drinks and cheap beer along with the option of beer pong (albeit on very small tables) makes for a nice afternoon.   Have been here a few times and it's pretty spacious, and not insanely crowded.  Bar staff is really nice and very quick.  They tend to have the game on, which is a plus.  As we were heading out there was a band setting up, which might have been nice to hang out for, but we weren't tempted enough to stay.  A nice low-key start to the night!

lU5qkrFbxZwI6gCQKoPrDA.review_text: Stopped by after the Fleet Week festivities. Your standard dive bar. Looks like they do live music in the evenings.

lXJpiJHkIiLv4ntFmVhDvw.review_text: just so-so and lemme discuss: skanks galore. skanks who don't know how to dress, skanks who don't know how to flirt. my prelude to dinner at Soldini's turned into a nightmare. 2 cocktails for the man and me, developing a nice buzz, enjoying the crowd (mostly frat types), until the plain loud janes clad in non-designer jeans, sporting skeezy long greasy hair, wearing the ubiquitous nasty flip-flops w/unpedicured smelly feet arrived in full force. go ahead fugly bitch, squeeze your fat ass into the bar stool next to me. you touch my Vuitton bag again, you'll be missing your dykey unmanicured man-hands.  these femi-nazis who are aching for boy attention surely know how to bring aversion upon themselves. downing their pints (what else do she-boys drink ?), getting louder by the second, adding dimensions to the word obnoxious. these female things are the new boys of the millennium, and every time I've been in this bar, they have polluted the place. the frat boys left in disgust after 20 mins, as did we.  next trip to Soldini's: I will patronize the in-house bar, which really has stronger pours than G & G. but G & G is a pretty cool saloon . . . they just need a sign outside that states "NO SKANKS ALLOWED"

PqF5Obzkc2JQSwTN8_1FHA.review_text: Lovin it.  Pretty much every time I've ever been here is playing with my band LowFat (we play tomorrow night June 6 btw).  It's a little small, but the size tends to keep everyone moving and having a good time.  One thing though, it can get super loud!  But it's all in good fun.  Drinks are fairly priced and there are even tables with tall chairs so you can sit and drink while talking to someone standing next to you at eye level.  Worthwhile stop when bar hopping.

N02U8Ubt3YaGFm03CdKqyg.review_text: I came here with two other people on a Friday night two weeks ago. I was appalled at the service we got from the blonde bartender.  After ordering our second round of drinks (that was the same as the first) she came up with two opened beers of the wrong kind.  I politely informed her we were not drinking that kind and she looked at me and gave me attitude replying " well sorry, I already opened them."  I was stunned. I could not believe any bartender would behave in such a manor!  Then when I simply said we had ordered someting different and I am sorry she came at me telling me how b"tchy I was.  We walked out right then and there.  I will not be going back there.  Poor management to let someone so rude talk to costumers like that.

BMJzhmEX1UPzXKhfI5zHaw.review_text: The skanky tatted bartender was a C U Next Tuesday.  Was hanging out with the fellas for a birthday celebration and after about an hour, we decided to put some money in the jukebox. Played some pool, were trying to get our buzz going while listening to a nice blend of punk, rap, metal and some old school country selections from Johnny Cash and Waylon Jennings etc.  The country music actually seemed to draw some ladies into the bar and other customers began to play a medley of music, including some country selections.    Then the slag started skipping the country songs.  About 4 songs over the course of a couple hours and she had it.  I confronted her about it and she got stupid, talking about it being her bar.  I had to remind her she was the employee and the customers were there to have a good time.  Nobody gives a crap about what music she wants to hear... serve the drinks, clean up the foul looking restrooms and shut your mouth about the music!    Dive bars are a dime a dozen and so are tattooed skanks.

ZflqpFl7va7Qeb9bMimt8w.review_text: I like this place.  It is sort of a dive bar and has free live music and no cover charge.  Drinks are reasonably priced.

IMduCo7CtFWSHIUrfJ4dzA.review_text: Imagine a North Beach pub where a coke costs only 2$ and you get free live music. Inspiring - great music.  I saw two bands perform on a Wednesday night and had an amazing time.  I counted about 60 people - most were locals or fans -  but there were four or five military guys dressed in uniform  - here because of fleet week.  I posted two pics.  What's so weird is that I've lived in SF many years - and just recently I heard of this cool place. Where have I been?  Although I brought a friend - it's an okay place to visit by yourself because G&G is  okay with your eating at the bar. Its especially enjoyable if you play guitar.  There are a few nice restaurants close by too.

AM8s4g3NafOfjrGkGCrNiw.review_text: Great bar with great live music. Will definitely return next time I'm in Telegraph Hill.

vTugBdYg34rX4KvGpzBrNA.review_text: Ya know, I've always enjoyed going to Grant and Green. It's pretty small, they are attentive to their customers in terms of drinks, they have a little stage and area to watch live bands play and it's in a central location to other good bars. Last night was especially fun because our friend's band was playing and it was packed with people attempting to mosh and dance. There's definitely a fun lovin' crowd inside and I've always seen hot guys when I've gone there. Total perk!

gEx19xm2RZQo4XdobKGkWQ.review_text: this place is, for lack of a better word, cool...  the bartenders are there to have a good time and it rubs out on the crowd.  live bands cram in there but it matters not!  the place is just all about being cool and having a good time.  car bombs flow like water and i welcome that whole heartedly.

H_tTGo0pWOAFvK8Hl60Y5Q.review_text: fuck yeah! great bands, great staff, and decent priced drinks for being up there in n. beach. throw in some scary bikers that hang out on weekends and a couple acts of extreme violence right outside the door, god damn i love that fuckin place.

nYufXwZH9ooB_zjNJf8Xlg.review_text: Columbus Cafe is pretty much my headquarters when I'm in North Beach, but I've been known to pop in here from time to time. Always had a pretty good time. They have live music which I'm not a huge fan of, but somehow I enjoy it when I come here because it fits. They also have a couple of big HDTVs so as I don't miss any action being the sports junkie that I am. Me and B watched Nevada upset Boise at this very spot. Good times. I hate Boise.

iHXWHiUrl4M3LxGjU49JhQ.review_text: One sip of beer and i could tell the taps need a cleaning!  Poor beer selection, grimy place, and the worst part is the horrible, rude, arrogant service at least by the weekend night staff. Stay away and go the other bars nearby that are clean, cool, and have tasty drinks and great service. In this economy, ill spend my beer money el$ewhere but here.

-f4yC1q8KbhQm0Gynqh4GA.review_text: I had never been to this bar before. I went with a friend to check out some live music. I did not expect a tiny ass bar with a teeny little stage over looking the tiny dance floor. I did not expect folk music. The company was pretty lame. If I lived near this bar...it might actually be a nice little bar to hang out at, but if your looking for a good time in the city, and drive all the way there for it...stay clear of Grant & Green, you will most likely be disappointed.

a3LavpLZ-rKG7xn1mQJgTg.review_text: I live right around the corner and its a great place to come in for a beer and chill after a long week. they often have live music with no cover which is awesome. the bar tenders can be a bit rude which is why the lack of star but all in all a great place!

Re0D5snuHFN9ycAfC-aglA.review_text: If you're a fan of live music coming from obscure local bands, this is your place. It is very loud here where conversation does not come easy. Drinks were expensive for a dump like this, but it is SF and a somewhat pricey area. Barback kept climbing over patrons to get behind the bar which I thought was odd. Went next door to Maggie McGarry's which could not be any different.

I1dKh4olStlU7i-hEi4_TQ.review_text: Cute little bar on Grant, almost like any other. There was a live band (Maybell or Maybelle) playing jazzy-esh music that night. The crowd was cool, not super young and not super old. Just HOT HOT HOT in there, they could bust a window or something open, overall good decent kind of place, if you're looking to just sip a couple of beers and chill to some loud local-ish music.

FI0dcCAuFmW0lutdKO2UwA.review_text: A dirty dive bar with ex convicts and mental patients for customers.  The music is usually horrible though I do like the fact that they support live music.  Place needs a makeover badly!

0FodgHLOC8oxknAlcaYx6w.review_text: On a karaoke Tuesday about a year ago I made the biggest decision of my life at this place. I don't know if it was the strong drinks, the fact that I sang a Partridge Family song, or the film student I was with...but that night made my life what it is today. For better or for worse, five stars just for that.

DSgA_du9Sdi1b6MeWUcEvQ.review_text: Dropped in for a few drinks last night.  The DJ was great, atmosphere good, bit the bouncer at the door was a complete jerk.  As we left we were trying to flag a cab in the rain.  He rudely insulted us as we tried to wait under the awning.  So unnecessary and not a way to treat customers.  Ruined our night.

5v6juPIOisfmogp7QSso-A.review_text: "Welcome to Grant & Green Saloon, Purveyors of Cold Beers, Strong Spirits & Good People." Grant & Green has a mellow punk vibe. There is a small stage for live acts. Posters of the Misfits and the Dickies adorn the walls. They have one of the best happy hour deals in town. From 4-9 pm, every drink gets you a token for another. There's also $4 Fernet all day if you're into that. Service is good, especially when the owner is behind the bar. There is a pool table and a Metallica pinball machine! The one major drawback of this place is that there is only one co-ed bathroom.

M4dHECn1VFdXdpWfiM38yg.review_text: I'm a bit miffed. I rolled over to Grant and Green to see my friends' band play on Tuesday night. Had some pizza at Golden Boy, walked around with some buddies to hand out some handbills to promote the show in the neighborhood and eventually got back to the venue.   The music was supposed to start at 8 to 8:15 but the manager was telling them they couldn't start yet. It was 8:30 by the time I got there. They were supposed to wait for a hand wave or something from the guy in charge who was merrily playing beer pong and drinking.   At about 8:45, after having several people ask him when the band would start came over and said that the concert is definitely not happening and the shuffling iPod DJ would continue. Everyone who came out to see the band was sort of awe-struck.   How many times has anyone seen a band be able to fully set up, sound check and be totally ready to go, with 20some people there to see them - and more on the way...... and then be told they can't play because: it would disrupt the cliquey beer pong tournament that had a whole 10 or so people playing in it.  We decided the best thing toi do was to clear out and left the place almost completely empty in the bar area with that dozen of people hanging around the beer pong tables.  I know one friend was asking for her money back for her beer, I hope she got it. Sure, the band got paid their $50, but that's not worth the price of them and their fans that came out getting jerked around.  This was a fiasco in management at the Grant and Green. I'm avoiding that place like the plague - there's always Mojito next door, where they value live music.  If you're a beers-willing 35 year old frat boy wanna be who want to relive the beer pong days, yay, by all means, but i can't get over how badly this was all handled by this guy.   Maybe other days there are better... I just can't get over this.  Sorry about venting.  but... seriously?

Rzjbl7-yV5anedZmJbbavg.review_text: This bar gets loud and crowded quickly. The drinks are priced well, and there are pool tables in the second room so it's worth the trip.  Fun place to drink, and I've heard it's a good place to come watch a baseball game.

a4r7b9qJI_1HwfVul-ns5A.review_text: One of our stops for Santacon... Cool beats, cool crowd, gross barf in the corner of the bar... NEXT!

YLy6HF5gqPjDgoT9VO5ZeQ.review_text: Douche baggy. Yikes! Will not be back here. I used to go here a long time ago and since moving to North Beach a few months back, I thought it would be cool to stop in.   I was really unimpressed. Place looks grimy and and bartender had a huge attitude with clientele. Too bad, the neighbors in the area need a friendly bar. Even we like to go out in our 'hood on weekends and don't need to be greeted with hostility. Will be hanging out across the street, service is way more pleasant.

B4cJvWuf59j7XlTdexnVZw.review_text: "Fairly pricey drinks are made up for by great live blues or jazz music in an intimate setting most nights with no cover, except occasionally weekends for big names. A lively, mostly upper 30s+ crowd. Not a good place if you want to be able to talk, though if a live session is in action because it's LOUD."

6ATfXxQLQuRAQ30-nLI6Yg.review_text: To be honest, even when I'm drunk I stumble past this place.  Live music almost every night, and a pretty cool "open blues Jam" every Monday night definately gives it a nice and unique feel.    They have some chill beer pong during the week, but if you show up on a weekend it's either a sausage fest or too packed to move.  I just can't manage to have a good time..  Thank god their chill during the week.  All in all it's not that good, but drop by for a quick cheap drink... $1 PBR on Mondays!

7Ek4da_Btvznc4Q4S0_Bag.review_text: I once saw a broken beer bottle fight here, involving a woman in a halter top made of feathers. And it was the '90s. This is the first place people go when they are released from San Quentin.

WlhUaI9enW0k6uEI1zIOmw.review_text: So let me tell you about Scott the bartender.   If they had good service it woulda been fine. But the bartender was too busy hitting on every girl who walked into the place to serve us. Every girl that walked in left until he finally got one and he actually came around the bar to hit on her while the guy she was with was in the bathroom. Man I would have been pissed if I was him.

CDwqBP_t-_G1dWRKrve72Q.review_text: This is the bar that is closest to my house and as such, I have become one of the foremost experts on it. Beer on tap, but not in pitchers. Monday night Live Jazz, Tuesday nights are Karaoke night. Every other night  there's pretty good live music with no cover, which I don't think you can say about any other NB bar. The crowd, in my experience, depends on the band that's playing. The people who work here rule!

-4wrMvkkJyTlCiD-geE8gQ.review_text: The place is very small but there is always very good music, with live music. There is always the same man dancing in front of the stage, alone, but he is really funny! There is a pool table and I like it.

uRKRDIjWBBrMJyuhGC1VLw.review_text: Sorry , I liked it better when it was a dive with an eighth inch of water on the very small bathroom floor. The Grunt and Groan was "the" dive in NB. Now it's what? Loss of soul.

7qOYwZ_KrKdWcMAwD-hIdQ.review_text: "they just let ANYONE in here, don't they?" "jess, this isn't LA"  um yeah. that was the exchange of the night, while i was at this bar. i was in town visiting my long lost friend/roomie from college Cat K. and she suggested we meet at this place. i didn't get lost getting there so i guess major points for having a name as obvious as this one. i like the idea of live music, but not when it's shitty. drinks were strong. so strong, in fact, i couldn't finish my drink. no cover (yay!) but i couldn't even imagine attempting to go to the bathroom here, so i didn't.   one thing i noticed about all the places i went to that night, including this place... there are hooks to hang your coat. random, but necessary. i don't live in a coat-weather climate, so things like that are a foreign concept.

65uUyG9yuF0rdMh0z7ajaA.review_text: One of the long-time live music venues in North Beach, G&G is a tiny little venue where you're never more than about 20 feet from the stage, but it's a great place to see a band up close and enjoy a beer.  And when you get hungry after all that drinking, golden boy is just around the corner!

8pONVRF4HDD9ynt5lCynTQ.review_text: This is painful. Grant and Green was an awesome place to see a friend's band on a recent night. The bouncer was nice and proactive about keeping the already-drunk-and-rowdies out. The drinks were ok and not too overpriced. One of the bartenders, however, needs a lesson from Miss Manners and so here I am to administer:  Dear Bartender with the tattoos, Thank you for being a complete bitch to my best friend, one of the nicest, smartest, most intelligent and respectful men I have known ever in my entire life. Not only  was he a shining star in a sea of douchebags last Friday night at your bar, but he was also the only patron I saw you berate, yell at, and more or less ask to leave. And why? Why did you do that, evil wench? Because he has a real JOB (he's a doctor) that requires him to carry a work bag and he had just gotten off a flight from LA and came straight to the bar to see our friend's band play. With all the handsiness and douchebaggery going on in your bar on Friday, I find it appalling that you chose to single out my friend for having a LAPTOP bag with him. You claimed it "wasn't working" to have it in the bar because it was "in your way" and that's not all you said.  And nothing you said was said in a remotely polite manner. Well, thanks to you, we all left. About 20 of us. 20 nice people who also happen to be good tippers and who were simply there to support our friend's band. Nice job. I hope you don't treat everyone with an education and a strong work ethic like this. Oh, maybe you do. That would explain the majority of your patrons I observed on Friday night.

LEho8AFSA-H6M9SekKxb_A.review_text: I've been here a couple of times, and I can't say that my experiences make me want to come back.    It's a low key bar, with no cover.  Sound great, except you can barely get through the door.  I get it, bars get crowded, it happens.  But the way the entrance and the bar is set up, you can barely get through because it's so narrow!  If you're lucky enough to get to the bar and order and drink, then you better not move from there.  If you're looking to go to a hot, musty place, where you have to fight your way to get through, then this is your spot.

BCbPFrcdfvPEnnNoWPCdPg.review_text: This bar is awful, and I'll tell you why.  Its a boring bar to begin with, I yawn everytime I'm there, waiting for my friends to finish their drinks so we can hit the next  bar.  But what really put this bar on my shit list is one Saturday night when me and a couple of friends stopped in for a quick drink before last call.  I bought a round and gave the tall bartender with a hat on my check card and told him to close it out.  Within 2 min he manages to GIVE MY CHECK CARD TO ANOTHER CUSTOMER!!  When I asked him for it he said "i gave it to you," and blamed me for not having it.    The manager was not much better.  He said "check your pockets."  These idiots didnt do anything to solve the problem except blame everyone else but themselves.  I had to cancel my card and have my bank credit  my money back for drinks I didnt buy.  Bottom Line.....This bar sucks and so do their employees.  So many better bars to hang out at in North Beach than Grant & Green.

Zk0RGkhWxcSlbsRzpu3DmA.review_text: We dropped in here the other night just in time to grab some barstools and found an excellent 90's cover band; the place filled up and quickly got pretty crowded.   I'd prefer paying less than $3 for a PBR can, but I guess it could be worse and they'll only set you back $1 during happy hour.

ILz8ApVEgTqbv5LnC6PyuA.review_text: I was lucky enough to have a good bartender who made a good drink. The live music hadn't started yet, which was good, since I was in the mood to talk and not yell. I usually walk right by this place since its always crowded and loud, but it was a good spot to have a quick drink during the week.

P7_vx8jtm7tNz38N1H1NWw.review_text: $4 for a pabst? and you fired my favorite bartender? and you whine to yelp when people have the gall to say they don't like your whack-ass bar? are you fucking kidding?  no, you are NOT kidding. really pricey drinks in a divey setting, some legitimately awful live music (but some good, it is true), few redeeming qualities and way too many better options -- on the same block -- to justify any of it.  fuck this place; i'm going to maggie's.

x7OKy4iW3VDzQjznlQEUxg.review_text: The drinks are ~eeena~. Some good music at times, hit and miss. Great location, but never seen it too busy except on the weekends. And on the weekends North Beach isn't what it used to be. Who told the frat-boy trust fund babies to come douche-it-up here? There's some decent pubs, but Grant n Green... hmm I'll say props for providing a venue for musicians, and for free, there's your two stars!

L4KJL44Yj3HkzAkKfm0PZw.review_text: Bartender was so nice here! We are visiting and she helped us get around as well as made me a bomb birthday drink! Great stop on your bar crawl.

Y0DzDIlTfA-iEOT3Sr02RA.review_text: this place is cool man.  We played here early this year and had a full house of crazy SF residents.  drinks are faily inexpensive and bartenders nice.  no parking though.

DQ550klyMQpntNaKnILzFA.review_text: Angry....crazy....and drunk are not characteristics I look for in a bartender, but if that sounds like ur cup of tea then this is your spot. Never again....

EUDuSd11Fhxm6ioLgvxFEQ.review_text: Probably have been here a dozen times, but honestly i never remember much of it.  That said, this is a sweet place to end up the night at the bars, especially if you are tired of savoy down the street.  The bartenders aparently can put with a lot from the drunken idiots that come in there around closing time (myself definately included!), so they have that going for them.. and as far as i can tell the drinks are good....  also, huge bonus points for the close proximity to North Beach Pizza...

z7KsQ_nfTZq6mm6ZPAk_Mg.review_text: My new Yelp rule is never give a place that is cash only 5 stars. We live in the 21st century now and places still don't accept cards. I believe this is just greed and I am the kind of person who despises carrying cash on me. This place is not a bar with a bunch of chicks so don't come here expecting a Bar None crowd. Mostly dudes who like dudes and hipsters.

2kaKMfwHKAFOSh1l8PpbGQ.review_text: Had a blast here friday night watching an upbeat cover band get their funk on with some irresistable Kelly Clarkson covers.  Can't say anything about the bartending, because I was already nice & snookered by the time I showed up, but I met some nice B&T boys who dragged us across the street for free Fernet shots.  Hurray!

dNuyFxs5zbArDsI2WpSOog.review_text: Everybody was having a good time until  the bouncer decided to ruin our bachelor/bachelorette party by being a total jerk, for no apparent reason dumping out people's drinks and ruining people's good times.  We will NEVER go back. Worst end to a fun night.

CDtbuyJBYyDT21lJMod6OA.review_text: GROSS!  That was what went through my mind the moment I stepped in!  The humid sticky air hits you full in the face... and you KNOW in that tiny bar that all that hot air is putrid, steamy HUMAN BREATH!  ew.  According to my friend, the band was butchering their cover songs as well.  But my one star is for the atmosphere... it's just a black bare box full of human breath.  Take a shower after you go there, or at least wash your face ASAP.  Luckily we were dragged here by other people... I'm never going here on my own decision.  Ew.

SSo_DqQkaLLuQccRapbRRQ.review_text: My friend loves this place for some reason so I've been here a few times. Not my favorite place. They do have live music which is kinda cool. That's about it...

NdcpQWfscQ1N1hF16CkZZA.review_text: In all honesty, one really can't go wrong with any of the bars on the stretch that is Grant ave.  However, Grant and Green is a head above the rest as a result of the quality of its music venue.  If the citizens of the US were willing to spend two terms on GWB, I think the people of SF owe it to themselves to spend one night with North Beach's own Green president.

eGvs2z4YHFVHC22pD0aVTg.review_text: I've been to this bar many times since it is just a couple blocks away from my apartment but the show I saw a couple weekends ago confirmed my feelings on this bar.  I saw one of my friends play in General Jones (great, great bad!) and it was an amazing show.  This location is great because they show fantastic music acts for FREE!   It is a great space - plenty of room to get nice and sweaty on the dance floor!  So, despite the door guy who smacks my ass as I enter the bar I will be a return customer again and again!

3HHLpfU7q4HoREEOXtt7pw.review_text: I came here with a friend for happy hour and enjoyed a couple $1 PBRs - thats one of their happy hour deals. I mean, how can you resist $1 PBR? Actually, I'm sure many can, but I digress...Grant and Green is a really chill spot and the bartenders and patrons are really nice. They thought my best friend and I were on a date and while my friend was in the bathroom, the bartender said "You deserve more than a cheap date...is he really only buying you $1 Pabst?" Of course I explained that we were best friends and that we were broke and just wanted to grab a drink somewhere, so that was that.   The next time I came here, I had a COMPLETELY different experience. My friends and I were trying to figure out a place to go for NYE. Most of them were broke, so we settled on a place that would be free that night. We originally wanted to go to Maggie McGarry's next door, but they were charging a $20 cover, so we went to Grant and Green instead.  It was pretty crowded, which I expected, but it was so hard to get a drink. The DJ was good and played songs that everyone could dance to - and fist pump - but they didn't start a countdown when it was about to be midnight. That was pretty lame. After that the night pretty much went downhill, but none of that has anything to do with Grant and Green, so...  I think I'll stick to happy hour here and probably try it out on a weekend again, but never for NYE.

83D1Bd0hE-d_dIp-NebR2Q.review_text: Chill environment. Live bands. $15 dollar minimum that they advertise. Pretty cut and dry.

zGs-QCpCRkGJU3PFPPjKNg.review_text: Quite cheap for North Beach standards! I've been to this bar twice now, both times on a weekend afternoon. They have some great deals: Fernet is available all-day at $4 and during happy hour they have a buy one get one free special for the beer on tap - with decent beer selection.   They have a small live music stage and they play music via the jukebox when there is not a band performing. Overall, the bar seems like a great place to get some cheap drinks casually in North Beach.

KqWg7ANbB3QKkNXM4lVA-Q.review_text: DUDE!  BRO!  Know what I'm saying?

JvQRbZYdMGuuDqTArles2g.review_text: Cash only bar with a semi-official looking ATM tucked away in a corner.  Decent live music.  Not a favorite, but okay...

ghRwENzjazf5b94m5ga5NQ.review_text: I headed on down to Grant & Green to catch a sweet show by a Tom Petty cover band called "Heavy Petty".  Though it's small, there was still plenty of room for our sizeable group to kick back at a table, enjoy the [rockin'] band, and watch folks shake what their mamas gave them.  The bar line was short and the bathrooms were even decent.  Come on ladies...you know that's a big deal.  The "Git er' Done" special of the night was $2 Olympia beer in the can.  Can't beat that; plus it makes you feel like an Olympian.   Best part: I can walk there and stumble back.

wtp71-5l5fR206Z0ZWYoKA.review_text: The manager is a douchebag fratboy type who has no interest in having the live bands the booking agent books. He'd just as soon they'd leave.  They book great bands and then treat them like shit.  I am a musician who had previously good experiences there in years past, but last time, the muscley douchebag bartender/manager Scott took my unfinished beer with a napkin on it, then yanked away the next one when I didn't immediately cough up $5. He acted like I was a swindler.  It would have been unprofessional of me to storm out, though I'd have liked to and had made promises to the players and fans to oblige.  To top it off, at the end of the night, the music was cut off without the customary one-song warning. This pissed off the fans who were there to hear us.   Don't ever go to see your friends play here, instead suggest they find any of a dozen other venues on that street, even if you have to pay a few bucks.  I read the stories about ping pong tournaments perempting the music and I'm not surprised at all.

TS2j_gt5qugbmQ1R_fq6TA.review_text: Good bar, where you aren't crammed in a bar with people and can have some cheap beers and watch the droves of North Beach walk by...

zDltf7SGyDANcA6ndZkF7A.review_text: I am all about a place that offers up beer pong that ISN'T Bar None. I will admit that I am a fan of this college-time drinking game, but I refuse to continue frequenting college-like bars where 21-23 year olds douche around too wasted to walk a straight line.   Grant and Green Saloon was a great spot for one of my Sunday Funday rendezvous - central to lots of other fun spots on Grant Street. No doubt I'll be back sooner than later.

PxV-kSdgt6IfAhlpnK_uGQ.review_text: For some reason my droogs wanted to watch the World cup game at the Steps of Rome. Afterwards they were going to crowd themselves into a phone booth.  A friend called to watch the match here and once I got past the crowded front room I had enough space for old school break dancing but based on the bad officiating I did not take part in old school break dancing.  They set up an extra bar so even though the place was packed I was able to get a drink quickly.

5d-qumDgxMxh1RLgJ5LY7Q.review_text: The bar was crowded but the people were a fun bunch. People who were there just wanting to watch live music for free on Thursday nights and have a cheap drink. Lots of places around this North Beach area to walk around and check out. I went here to watch a Weezer cover band. The sound of the PA is pretty good so I liked it. Kinda stank like an armpit though. But what else can you expect from a saloon?

CRLA264qZO-IxB2gQOnJmg.review_text: I don't think this place deserves the low ratings that it receives.   The Sunday bartender is a cool cat and he's not a douche.    If you are there at night when it's busy, the guys at the door are nice & just doing their job. They have never bothered us and I've been there with guy cousins as well as with the girls over several years when we end up at Grant. Same treatment. Never had a complaint.   Don't believe everything you read on Yelp. Isolated incidents v. themes. Figure the difference.

bXD3HfsnFeoY2Kw9QR4Zbw.review_text: Came here randomly with a group of friends during a night where they had live music. It was super loud and we basically had to shout over the music to even talk to each other. Not really sure what to make of this place since I've only been here once and the  crowd was a weird mix.  $15 min if you want to use a card.   Quickly finished our drinks and left to another bar. Wouldn't go out of my way to come here.

NWdAilati5XuEqKFOHTbCA.review_text: Here's a review of the place from the perspective of someone who has played a number of shows here over the years:  Pros: -Floor layout:  The area in front of the stage is relative small, so that helps make it seem like the place is packed with people and also makes everything that much louder.  The bar is off to the side, so that makes it easier for people not there for the band to stay away, and I'm sure it's nice for the bartenders who will have an easier time hearing drink orders.  Oh, another big bonus... no need to haul your gear up a huge flight of stairs because everything is on one level. -Foot traffic:  It's North Beach and there are always people walking around in the area, so chances are you'll be playing in front of more than just your gf/bf and perpetually single friend who's got nothing else better to do on a weekday/night.   -Other stuff:  TWO Ceiling mounted fans pointing at the stage!!!  Given the tiny ass stage this makes a HUGE difference.  In the past, it would feel like a freaking sauna on stage.  Bar staff/bouncer dudes have always been respectful and A-OK to me.  Oh, and no cover charge, so there's no excuse for your cheapass friends to come out to see your awesome band.   Cons: -Stage:  it's tiny, and if you're anything more than a 3 piece, you better make sure everyone in the band loaded up on deodorant.  Consider backlining with other bands as much as possible, otherwise prepare to setup your gear FIFO, not LIFO (you know, because the stage isn't deep enough for more than just one band's stuff).   -Sound:  No monitors (as of Oct 20, 2012), soundcheck, or sound guy.  Note to whoever in the band stands closest to stage right:  the mixer is in front of you so you'll likely be your band's sound guy.  Expect everything to sound like shit from the stage.   -Parking:  is pretty much impossible on the street... a number of hourly/fixed rate lots are nearby if you're low on parking karma -Other stuff:  No separate access for loading in/out means you have to wade your way through the crowd to make it to the front door.  No green room (but you probably knew that if you're playing here).

lBaoq2G8xXrSX_esMQXM-A.review_text: I'm a big fan of a local bar and this one hit the spot on Saturday. Nothing fancy just great local atmosphere and a few colorful patrons. Music was great, bartender was friendly, beer pong was in progress and I was able to get a slice at a local pizza joint and eat at the bar.  Drinks were reasonably priced.  Not over priced like some touristy SF joints but have cash on hand, credit cards not accepted.  They even had my booze, score.  Going back a block off Columbus reminded me of the North End in Boston which I love. Next visit to the city we will scope out more of the local hangouts.

WbB_Wzy5OeLrT9w9p-MJ7g.review_text: One of those places that are awesome drunk, but when sober you realize how bad it smells and how dirty the bathrooms are.   Great stage for live bands though and all together it's a great atmosphere.

JnGtgOPpkjyWOvWM0SYEXg.review_text: havin' lived in northbeach many moons ago....up above the kearny steps..coit tower hill....grant 'n' green just a stroll down hill to the bottom....a frequent stop during the ol' grant street pub-crawl.....crowds haven't changed much.....out of towners stickin' to the main broadway 'n' columbus roads....grant 'n' green still safe bet for locals.....beers, booze and mingle....seekin' a mellow evening...early is best....towards the peak hours....crowds, loudness and bands pursue....

Xq7KR3Rbzz35bs01BGKj9w.review_text: Popped in here on St. Pattys day, one of the few places that didn't have a huge line, huge cover, or huge anything else. It's pretty small. It was crowded as hell, but the bartenders were being quite efficient and we didn't have to wait as long as I expected for a drink. Probably because it's cash only and that's easy. They had a DJ going with decent music, and of course all the @#$%shows from St. Pattys celebrations. But it was rather inexpensive, the bouncer dude was plenty nice, and it wasn't as bad as I figured it would be despite the drab decor.

51f-gzLdOCAeSNyhdXJX6Q.review_text: I prefer Grant and Green for day drinking purposes. I most recently stopped by here during the North Beach festival, it was a great place to stop in and get out of the heat for a cold beer. The staff is super friendly and they have live music! Only downside is that they are cash only!

ymD3-y21FyUOvsbAu4zqJw.review_text: I'm from southern california & my girlfriend knows i love dive bars & she recommended that we go here. Yes this place is anything but fancy, but it's a DIVE BAR!!!! They ONLY accept cash. So make sure you hit up the ATM before coming here. Also they make their own brew which only cost a dollar. So that is a lil nice treat for you ballers on a budget. lol Anyways I had a such BLAST here!!!! The bartender (Scott) was hilarious && nice (just make sure u dont get him in any camera shots. He hates that crap). He served us until his shift was over & still hung out for a lil while after at the bar with the customers!! I felt REALLY welcomed here. This place made my 1st trip to San Fran amazing & intoxicating! If u are from out of town && are looking for a dive bar && a good time I recommend coming here! Good times, good music, good vibes.....

opOXJ4fe3sIUhQAFL4lmbA.review_text: I've been here a couple times now in the past few months and I actually regard this place as a fairly friendly place to go right after dinner in the more strictly culinary area of North Beach along Columbus ave. I've seen a couple of bands here, and they play all night. I'm not much of a drinker, maybe more of a people watcher, but dive bars such as this suit that purpose well. They are cash only. They have a small standing area and a random, very conspicuous Deer Hunting video game that attention enthusiasts can use to get noticed since its right in the middle of the room in front of the bathroom entrances. Seating is sparse but the general feel is friendly; you'll never get stranded among people when trying to get out for too long like you would down at Tupelo.

yVXR8ghRqFppf7UAQPegRA.review_text: Goddamn.  And I mean GODDAMN.  Where are you finding these bands these days???  Not only are they talented, they are damn good looking!  Thank you for the dance floor!

9nwsUQDa2vqzP2dGWQI8gw.review_text: Went there once while some jazzy/salsa type band was playing. Dont remember a whole lot of it except for the fact the band let me and my friend play on the drums and keyboard for a while during their break and then serenaded my friend!! It wasnt too crowded and easy to get a drink. Best part, it was right around the corner from Golden Boy Pizza!!

0mvmhuKngfBClglporQK9Q.review_text: ugh.  this place is so..how do you say it...  oh yeah,  chico.

k8k3AyxPkQfw4L4Fo-upnw.review_text: I love this bar!  They have live bands every night or at least it seems like they do every night.  I've seen some great bands and there's always a good group of people there.  The bartenders are nice and last weekend when my friend was cold the bartender offered his jacket!  I recommend this bar to anyone headed to North Beach plus there are a million bars right next door.

CSvgpDZt8i_JvThh7E9Otw.review_text: Came here while bar hopping in the area, and we had to fight to just get through the door -- meaning they would have a really huge issue with the fire department.  It was absolutely impossible to move around the place, and we couldn't even think about trying to get a drink.  The decor is like your normal dive bar, and everyone there looked like they were having a great time.  I can't get myself to give this place more than 2 stars since my experience was so poor, but I am willing to give it another try.  Hopefully this time they keep watch as to how many people they're letting in.  I know it sounds like a 'buzz kill' but, in my opinion, it'll make for a more enjoyable experience.

rK8kLDiaKoIexHy3JzcVCA.review_text: I've only been here once.  Made a friend with some drunk guy who imports Belgian cookies or something.  I bet cute boys come here a lot.  I like cute boys.

7tEUgFoRzy_TkOgzPQzCkA.review_text: My girl works the bar and works it good.  I love GG.  They have fab drink specials and live music every night.  Good times!  Go, Go, Go.

Dn2gtoQnMgf261kIXpjLvA.review_text: live band. stiff drinks. prices are reasonable. so loud in here that you can barely hear yourself think.  very crowded.  staff are all pretty nice.  great place to get hammered with a group of friends.

tx407EtvKoXXEZqYQFQVJA.review_text: I was here on a dead Thursday night to see my friends play (myspace.com/arshiasoul).  At 9, when I got there, it was pretty much just the band and their friends.  It filled in more over the next couple of hours, though. The bartender was quick and was pretty cool, and he didn't slap me when I ordered a Fat Tire Sherry for someone (that's more than I could say for myself, though I must say the idea intrigues me). The stage was reminiscent of the Red Devil Lounge, in that there was probably no stage in mind when the place was built, but they do pull it off fairly well.  There was a LOT of mike feedback, and there was no lighting on the front of the stage, but considering the place, I can't hold that against it. I'd be more than happy to come see a show here again, or come back for a mellow weeknight with a friend or two.

hv5PwwLU3cS-fZTV5s-QHQ.review_text: this whole section of the city is one of the best kept Secrets in San Francisco , the service is OK,  kinda crowded , but it was on the North Beach festival , great dive bar.

NYDvprxYyDm1dJj8g_G0RA.review_text: I could hardly catch my breath it was so hot in this bar (and on a REALLY cold night in SF).  It is super stuffy and with bands playing in there it is WAYYYY too small for the acoustics they have going on in there.  When I left my ears were ringing for days - that can't be good can it?!    If you go with a group of people, don't expect to be able to talk to anyone other than the person sitting right next to you...even then you have to yell in their ear.  The bands are fantastic, but I like to hear them without flinching when they get closer to the mic.   I asked for a dirty martini and while it wasn't very expensive, it was ITSY BITSY.  Imagine a tumbler, but half that size.  I was pretty disappointed.  They have pear cider here, which I love.  I wish more places had it available.   Overall: 2 stars - Way too crowded, way too small, no air, and small drinks.  Oh, and CASH ONLY people!  If you come with a debit or credit card you're screwed.

pgHCj7DSqI8NWx7WucnH3w.review_text: The best part of Grant & Green is hearing the following phone conversation outside on the curb:  "We're at a bar in North Beach it's called Grant and Green...where is it?...ummm...I don't know...its....let me check....its on the corner of...Green...and Grant...OMG!! Grant & Green!!!...I TOTALLY get it now!!"  I think I've heard that conversation at least a half dozen times and it never gets old. But seriously, Grant & Green should be renamed "Hit or Miss" because its either awful or really fun.

mF3kBOQEHeTkd51W3D4ZjQ.review_text: I hold the 2nd and 4th highest scores on porno-photo hunt. This bar rocks!

j3hyELLtfNyxWAkGPN1Reg.review_text: Beckoning from the street, the sign outside this mega-dive promised $4 tall boy PBRs. For me, the biggest fan Mr. Pabst ever had, such a promise sang to me like some irresistible mating call. So we ventured into this dark, dank little dive with hopes high.  But alas, it was a lie - a cruel joke. They were OUT of PBR.  How DARE you cruelly crush my liquid dreams and force cheap vodka on me instead?! For this insult alone, Grant and Green fell from grace in the eyes of this dive-bar aficionado.   The place is a hole in every sense of the word. Surly bartenders, cash only, a loud loud loud live cover band and unbelievably inebriated patrons dropping bows and screaming gibberish.  The band wasn't bad - a shade better than mediocre. Some decent tunes filled the room, but the drunken band of idiots occupying half the establishment took away from some of the entertainment value. I'd forgotten, in a city where last call takes its final breath at 1:30am, the populous needs to get their drink on EARLY. So expect to find stumbling fools aplenty at 10pm.   I would potentially return, if only to see if they could fulfill their broken promise. And perhaps, with enough PBR in my little system, I'd be a better sport about the rabble-rousers, the weirdos and the stumbling half-wits that surrounded me.

4YT_epIQ7l3fMD2byhbllA.review_text: 3 words: Sex Type Thing Keep in mind that this review is based primarily on the live band that was playing when I went there, you guessed it...Sex Type Thing. A friend invited me along and mentioned that some of the members were also members of Tainted Love...that got me right there, I was in! I love cover bands and this one played all the memorable 90s stuff. Ah, memories.  Any excuse to dance like a complete fool in a divey-type bar and get out of the Marina is enough for me. Beer was good and cheap and I like small venues to see bands. I'll be back with my dancing shoes on!

LUj0l-kLPO9OUdg1bahiww.review_text: We came here for shelter from the rain and decided to get a few drinks. This is your typical saloon so don't try to order something fancy. It's simple and convenient. I don't think I'd come back unless I was in the area. It has a sports bar type vibe with a bunch of flat screens and screaming sports fans!

UCTin7iQ_oR0E11EYemsEw.review_text: A decent North Beach bar for friends. Not for a date.  Sometimes they get some great live bands playing cover songs.   The bad: A bit crowded on good nights and it sort of has that sticky floor, frat house basement feel.

o0oxyu1qnQrutZo1GCGwMw.review_text: Great bar. Great bartenders. One of the best bloody marry's as well.  The only issue is on weekends the music starts at around 5 and it's loud. there is no need for some band to be on stage when there are more people in the band than at the bar.

e1FuiYSV1v29q2OTR9ojBA.review_text: This is a pretty divey bar, but it can be fun to hang out and just chill on a weeknight or maybe a weekend afternoon - no real "scene" to worry about.  Everyone is usually pretty friendly, but I've noticed that this bar (as well as many of the other small dives) has its share of neighborhood drunks - as in, dang, what time did you start drinking, 10am?  (Maybe it's a North Beach thing?)  At night on the weekends, they usually have bands playing...then it gets way too overpacked.

E6RTdVTqzim2wOviazV3TQ.review_text: Good neighborhood bar - music is hit and miss.  I've seen some great bands and some not so great bands.  Drinks are cheap, service is quick and friendly.

HF15grCzeujuTX2f5kqygQ.review_text: Fancy it aint. But, it has a great (chip based) happy hour. It has free live music on many weekend nights and the bouncer recognized after a few times there and always shakes my hand.   Bartenders are friendly and some are genuinely interesting  Besides, how often does a random chick throw a feather boa around you and drag you to the dance floor.   You never know what will happen.

-B-QEUESGWHPE_889WJaeg.review_text: On a recommendation for a locals joint I made my way to Grant & Green and was not disappointed. This must be where it happens. Good selection of beer on tap, quick service from a standing room only bar and terrible live music combined with a dark and dirty feel. I love it! Nothing special about this dive and that's what makes it great.

4jGrJC5jdwEDoNqWAG0pPg.review_text: This is my favorite bar in North Beach but their New Years Eve DJ was the biggest jerk I have ever seen perform here. I haven't ever seen someone take breaks to make out with random girls during songs. He was exceptionally rude to people who I saw request songs. I hope Grant and Green doesn't decide to use him again.

nu4NZLFnJ57TIIwSsXd33w.review_text: Grant and Green is a small treasure of a dive bar located in North Beach.  The venue is small, perhaps 600  - 700 sq feet.  The bar a long bar and the wait is never over 5 minutes. The bathrooms open face the entire venue leaving it smelling like urinal.   The only reason this place gets a moderate review is due to the quality of bands the stage houses. The two times i have attended Grant and Green the bands have ripped and roared their notes into my heart via the sweet jam of classic American rock.

aIqtnxoopMTWARZNCqlY1w.review_text: Ya never know what you're going to get!  On Saturday it was a bunch of crunchy people,two guys with dreads to their waists, some bros, some overdressed girls and a chick in a red glitter bra, a thong and a chain mail loincloth.  Hoo boy!

6QN6BdpcDKXNS9Xq_7pECQ.review_text: the female bartenders will do shots with you and call you daddy!

VlYnsiwt0fPsqrAF1_D7hg.review_text: I've always just thought Grant and Green was some place that booked mediocre bands then stuffed the space with the band's friends. However last time I was there I had the pleasure of meeting some "regulars" and by regulars I mean a bunch of moody, pissed off dudes hanging out by themselves. One guy went so far as to have the bouncer kick out patron's he didn't like.   Crappy local bands?  Dudes with bad attitudes throwing their weight around?  Beer in plastic cups?   This bar isn't "college" its "high school" and its lame.

dTcYw_RuYUm-j83emwDnUQ.review_text: WHAT?!?! Is this an 18 and under Karaoke dance party? I'd say it is... Can someone tell the kids that Karaoke rap just doesn't work. Hey, better yet, DJ... Turn off that mic! I had to take myself right out of there after continues pain to the ears. I finished my special water and walked the hell out.   Alright... so that was one experience. I tried it out for the second time. It wasn't much better. I figure, if I am sucking down my drink faster then a bubbolicuous losing its flavor means, BORING!!!

eBnToKDLoXxQvpwY6s5UdQ.review_text: definite dive bar, don't usually visit this bar however we heard that there was a great cover band there that evening so of course we had to go and see.... wow the band was great and this was a really great venue to see a live band, very roomy and they have TVs that monitor the stage...so you're up front even when you're not. The drinks were on the pricey side and the bartenders seemed to have hearing problems....a rum and coke because a vodka diet, umm...shouldn't you be used to the noise level already? also the floors feel like they have been drowned in sugar you literally stick to the floor not good when you  are in heals...overall though a great experience

0FyfxrAMHm7AlrAkAXZQ9Q.review_text: Solely for the bartenders and ambiance, this place gets 5 stars.  We were drenched and needed a fun bar to watch college football, thankfully we stumbled upon this gem.  NIce bartender, fun and friendly, he made our day.  Nice drink selection.  Tip:  They only take cash.

GrUjyOfjODiCfwM0mCbo1w.review_text: So basically, this bar attracts meathead douchebag guys and mean girls (like, as portrayed in the Lindsay Lohan film.  The kind that still asipre to be "the most popular girl in school" even though they graduated from Chico 3 years ago and are now employed somewhere full time.  Probably a pharmaceutical sales firm or Bloomingdales.)  Also, I WATCHED a girl get roofied by a creepy old man.  When this girl was falling on the floor totally incoherant, I took her by the arm, helped her gather her things, and walked her toward the door, where said creepy old man told me that the girl was his friend, that I was a cunt, and that he would have me kicked out of the bar "cuz he knew the owner".  This dude was like... 65.  So after the doorman told me to "let them go" and then confessed that this guy is a regular and practiced this routine with some frequency, I realized I was in the 7th ring of hell.  So, to drown my depression, I ordered another $5 PBR (recieving sneers from the Bloomies Girls drinking Stoli Razz & 7up or whatever) and slinked back to my table, which was now inhabited with Crazy Tattooed Face guy who was waving his arms in an attempt to put a voodoo hex on an acquaintence of mine.  After the BF's friend's band was done playing, I practically ran away screaming.

oJ6bb4wnKCNT8v4U53FzFA.review_text: Two Words: SNAKE JUICE.   This place rocks my ass so hard it hurts. My absolute favorite neighborhood bar. The drinks are like my men - big and strong (cheap, too!). The only venue in the city you'll find Jungle Rooster and Tommy Castro playing back to back.   This is also, incidentally, the only place I'll pee when I'm out in North Beach. Clean bathrooms that fit 10+ people. Drink a lot, dance a lot, wiz a little. Good to go.

mdVbJZj3Sluoqw_v-vEe8Q.review_text: This is for the douche bags at the door. Rude meat heads with inferiority complexes. I went to this bar only to wait for some friends that wound up there. I never go here because it always looks like a mess from the outside. So when I arrive it was closing and they weren't letting anyone else in. We really just wanted to get our friends attention that we could see 10 feet from the door. One of the door guys closes the door (before 2am so the place is actually still open) in our faces as he leaves. I step aside so he can get by but insists on walking where I step which apparently sets this guy off. He starts on us like I'm trying to mess with him. Seriously? I'm half your size. I'm sober, and not trying to get into anything at 2am. My friend calls him rude and he gets all roid. We are totally civilized in calling him out on his behavior. He continues on with his "stop talking that stupid shit, bro" rant as we wait for our friends to come out. And at the same time the larger door guy starts shoving some guy who wanted to use the bathroom inside. He was telling him  not step to him and that's why he physically pushed him hack all the way to the corner. Really? He's 1/3 your width. Not called for. The skinny guy was not aggressive or rude. So physical force was ridiculous.  The roid dude finally disappears and our friends come out so we can finally leave. I'm not one to put anyone on blast on yelp, but that was so highschool and such an unprofessional display right in front of their storefront I needed to let the Yelp commnity know.  I'm embarrassed for Grant & Green Saloon to have these two working their doors...

_V6qMBCSzhwx96FLB3CJRw.review_text: Ooooh a sausage fest!  With an average age of 25!  Although I was repeatedly assured that I was NOT a cougar (damn!), I still felt extremely old in this place.    Maybe it's because I'm a girl, or maybe it's because I still had on my full Britney gear, but I appreciate bouncers who don't give me crap when I wander in and out.  Which tends to happen... a LOT.    It's doubtful I will be back unless my friend comes to town to play thins place again, and I didn't try the drinks...but if you're a young chick who needs a little lovin', this is your place.

s4_WxFxjKKRh40H7XJmF-w.review_text: OMG, the bartenders here are amazing.  I came in with Santacon last Saturday.  About 200-300 Santas descended on the place the second that they opened the doors.  I was one of the lead Santas and got a seat at the bar.  The bartender asked for 90 seconds to get things ready.  And really, that's all the time he took.  Then the bar back came in (right on time for his shift) and they started.  They divided the bar in half and worked it like I've never seen a bar worked.  Within 10 minutes every Santa who wanted a drink had one.  Unbelieveable.  And the bartenders were smiling and super cute!  I can't wait to go back.  p.s.  Santa can do anything!  I never knew that before . . .

VtnCudEFLBjnxblLUAPYhA.review_text: Let's cut to the chase. It's a dive bar.   We stumbled onto this place after dinner. The bartenders were awesome, the atmosphere (loud and crowded) was ideal and the drinks were stiff. Bonus was a 2 for one beers before 9pm.  Love this place. It's everything you could ask for in a dive bar. Poorly laid out, unisex restroom, badly in need of a remodel, edgy staff, an 80's cover band (more heart, then talent but I'm good with that) and single pool table in the middle of the dance floor.   If the walls could talk, oh the stories they could tell.

_GUOBCfoPSaUtM1AqgH-HA.review_text: I love this place, and I love Ashley......she is the BEST!!!!  Great dive bar to just hang, listen to music, watch the game, and have fun!!!

fcLg6igOVfs3ZTvBADNtNQ.review_text: A little gem in North Beach.... and really dark.  A true neighborhood bar.

6KpxOoUnQyYGTd3Fuwk_lA.review_text: The happy hour is great!  It's every day and is buy one get one free, drafts and well drinks.  Nice bartenders, manager, owner, and door guy.

GkPylOWk6V_4axnsl7Nlmw.review_text: Just, no.  I used to go here all the time when Robbie & crew owned it, and the current owners are not an improvement.  North Beach does not need freakin' beer pong - we are not the Marina.    Even worse - when I alerted the owner to the fact that a very drunk girl had been followed into the bathroom by a strange man, he first said, "That's not my problem, it's [the bar manager's]."  When I reminded him that as the owner, he's responsible for what goes on in the bar, he said, "Well, she'll get what she deserves."  Combine that with the known dosing that goes on, and this is not a good bar for women to go to.    Plus, they crank the sound system up to an insanely loud level, even on weekdays  when the neighborhood is quiet.  (Yes, North Beach can be quiet.)  This is not a good bar anymore, and this is not a safe bar.  It's too bad, because they do have some awesome bartenders.  But still, no.

DVHv1Xq2GsN2RvA0RJAK9Q.review_text: They didn't kick us out when we arrived at 9:30 pm blacked out from an all day pub crawl.  That get's an "A-OK" in my book anyday.

wQdr_MqZs1tD6Iahp8w5zw.review_text: Church Key is where we were headed, but it closed just as we got there. There was a large crowd outside here, but not a line, just people hanging out enjoying the music.  The live band playing was really good, right up until they took a break. Great drinks, good music... a surprising end to the evening.

-21cwFKEb2LsotmcB6U0JA.review_text: I mean, the place as a couple of TVs. It sells alcohol, and it's in North Beach, which is cool.  However, this place is not dive-y enough to be a true dive, nor is there a shotglass of class (or @ss) in there. Let's be honest- a halfway dive is just a dump. That's what this place is.   The best thing about the place is that it can host live music on stage. That is certainly a perk.   I never understood the draw to the bar, however. It's not really a neighborhood hang out (and this neighborhood DRINKS!) . The location is great- perhaps, that's the draw.  Anyway, I think that the bald manager who thinks he's God's gift to revive cool needs to know that slinging crappy drinks and Pabst ain't original . I think you are better off going to a bar where there is some sort of personality.   On a good note, the bar is walking distance to some good food and bars and prices are reasonable.

RTxrmkysuFxpuyTvveUybA.review_text: Good music. Local bar. Good prices. Good service. Stumbled upon this bar in North Beach because of the Happy Hour sign buy one get one free everyday from 4-9! Great Deal. Sat at the bar and it reminded me of a local Boston bar. Good rock music. We had drinks until after 9 then wanted dinner and asked if we could come back with food and sit at the bar. The bartender said no problem, so we left and came back. By that time there was a DJ and people dancing, but low key and down to earth. The owner was very cool and made me a special drink upon my request. No frills place, but good vibe and felt comfortable. Not trendy. Would definitely come back when I'm in town again. $5 cocktails and beer. Can't beat that in SF.

KQ_gl2MqmlMM-qyeDtOWMA.review_text: I like this small space to listen to live music on an off night.  Not good when it gets super crowded on weekends or during North Beach drinkfest events.

W9PUOzPRRXqSrN-sBEZogA.review_text: A good place to see some low-key live music and have a few drinks. The crowd is unremarkable, which is actually a plus if you're tired of dealing with people in the Marina or the Mission.

T0NP8VvoTYdsj5YSYilvLA.review_text: Fun. Fantastic staff. Bands are great.  Drinks are cheap for Nth Beach.  I will be back.  Whenever I bring friends in here, they have a great time.  Mixed crowd.  It can get busy though, so be prepared to fight for your space. Great happy hours every week night.

z0sEgQHuKrRSBigUkaGKiQ.review_text: I had a terrible experience with Grant and Green.  The bar booked my friend's band to play a show two nights ago, and after setting up all their equipment, the management told them they were canceling the show because there was beer pong going on.  Both the concertgoers and the beer pong players couldn't see why the two were mutually exclusive, but the management refused to hear otherwise or compromise.  90% of the patrons walked out of the bar on the spot.  Unbelievably disappointing management.  This was my first impression of/experience with Grant & Green, and I plan to avoid the place from now on.

w8w6jHFQI_GDRa4SJOSn2g.review_text: best dive bar ever.  Real peeps posers easily WEEDED out! For pro's only! After 11 Fernet shots 4-8 happy hour!!

IBaDaTxp2yC_-AD2QscBOA.review_text: Good place to listen to music and drink and maybe dance if the music is good - was fun the night we went.

jfyBHSgBWKDa51nO5js5pg.review_text: Free live music? I'm there! This is another one of those cash-only bars, but the drinks are reasonably priced. The crowd is always decent and it's my go-to place for music on the weekends. Hasn't failed me yet.

hNG5O7DapDKd56Pf2J3sUg.review_text: Difficult to find, hard to park, and worst of all, the staff doesn't do nearly all it could with its stage. Singers would sound better with some monitors.

PCMwR2hEJFisU65D6ojGBw.review_text: The place has a nice feel to it, but cheap drinks?  How drunk were you?  Five bucks for a beer is a bit pricey, but it IS North Beach so...eh.    Nice music, decently mixed crowd, usually allright getting a drink, and the bathrooms are indeed fantabulous.

xLgipMEceGu1iKT5As9iZg.review_text: OMG! Love this place! I bartend in the north beach area as well and know good bartenders/bars when I see em! The bar manager Zack, Blaze, Zoe and Scott are awesome! they are super fun, attentive and just all together rad! I love this bar and I highly recommend it! Live bands and Kareoke all week long. Looking for a good time? you'll find it here!

eNHZABmkbd-6S5WZtmXC8A.review_text: Grant and Green is great.  Extremely fun place, great live music (if you can, see the Sublime cover band.. they are awesome!), and good priced drinks.  I have had a great time every time I've come here.  The crowd obviously varies night to night, but I feel like the crowd is a step-up from your typical Marina/North Beach crowd.  Obviously not anything amazing or earth shattering, but it's always a great time.

yfG8hiLv0mA0ltTNXERuYQ.review_text: Stopped in here for a drink while walking the neighborhood, it wasn't much of anything special. The bartender was unfriendly and boring, not a big selection of alcohol. The main reason we stopped in was because it was during the day, about 2:30 P.M. and we were looking for an open spot to have a drink,but with all the other selections in the neighborhood, not sure if we'll be going back.

Tj-dZQNgz2pNpBGLvCkm6A.review_text: Prototypical dive bar not the type to make you feel dirty for hanging out in it. Happy hour is a good bet if you like to drink for cheap after work (the whole bar is cheap). Dollar black stars until they run out (I guess this is how most of the deals there operate). I can't comment on the live music - which I haven't seen - but there always seems to be enough people hanging around on those nights. Has TVs but wouldn't say its a sports bar

dfYNTBw--CYlZbFz581kYQ.review_text: Okay bar but definitely not my favorite. The live music is fun to walk by in North Beach but, when you get a bit closer to it (when you're in the bar), it's actually not that great usually... it's hard to get too far back in the bar and I always seem to get stuck near the front door. At least you can still order drinks there though! The crowd is fun and chill and you definitely don't need to dress up to head to this bar!

wAeREtzI0ca_QCQiuXDwIQ.review_text: Pretty chill dive bar, but if you want a cooler crowd and a cleaner feeling spot, I recommend Columbus Cafe.  They do have live music or comedians every now and then which is pretty cool.  Check it out, it's worth spending some time in if you live in SF!

5j0QmE-ktdY2wfEYX2YStA.review_text: I have been visiting this bar for the last year and a bit so thought it was about time to write a review.   There is something about walking into a bar on a Friday night when you are not really in the mood for a mad one ,, but fancy some music and a few ales....Grant and Green is perfect for that.   Ben on the door is friendly and smiley ( such a rarity in this city), the bar guys and gals are courteous and quick and the music is often really good.   The space is small .. but I always find room to jig a little.   Hope to bump into you here sometime !

q8w4WFxssJTYHOuvAUz8dg.review_text: This is a great Bar! Same ole bar scene but they play reggae every other Saturday, I believe. And I love Reggae! There's also a pretty good size dance floor.   One thing I can't stand is there bathroom, YUCK! I think last time I went the sink was on the ground and people were using it as an urinal. So I did what I do best... grabbed a bunch of toilet paper and went outside to pee on the sidewalk.

1ljC2JgUafYC9wtEUXJ3bQ.review_text: i like that they had a live band. i like that service was pretty fast, and that there were some drink specials. i liked the set up of this place.  it wasn't too crowded.  it's just not really my scene.  there were a lot of guys, and i was extremely overdressed as usual.  some of the guys were getting sloppy and pushing each other around.  i had half a beer spilled on me.  not really a place for a girls' night out... or any night out for me.

51tDMOV1mOmTECztMQdszw.review_text: A simple bar with live music several nights a week, what more do you need?  Check to see whose playing...

UE-rXhA8njNnADFkDA3EuA.review_text: Decent place to chill with spotty live acts (guitar duo sucked).

NkVYcoaThHjOfTTgq6OdHQ.review_text: right next to the lost and found, this place is usually busy on the weekends. a very low-key and 'rougher' crowd than i usually am used to, but it can be a fun place to get a beer and watch a ballgame.

rxMcRsCn_w7DHb797lYqOw.review_text: This bar gets 5 stars alone for booking one of my favorite singers EVER to play.  Shannon Curfman playing at the Grant & Green Saloon is the sole reason that I first set foot in San Francisco.  I stepped out of the Embarcadero BART station, feeling like Mary Tyler Moore in a lovely city.   I was rather pleased with myself too, for using public transportation for the first time in my life.    Later that evening, I ended up at the Grant & Green.  The band was late, but the bartender was amazing.  I had a straight-up, slightly dirty, vodka martini right away, and was immensely pleased with how quickly it came, and how perfect it was.  The bartender didn't even bat an eye when my male companion ordered a lemon drop.  We hung around this bar for hours...  And when my male companion left to move the car, the bartender bought me two double washington red apple shots, and then gave my male companion a freebie too.  You all have this lovely lovely bar, and the fabulous Shannon Curfman (who rocked my socks off that night), to thank for me coming to this city and falling in love with it.

2pBmUTpG-ckHwMsUvYN-Jw.review_text: Grant and Green is a good bar. It was not hard to get a drink or few and the crowd was very diverse. I didn't get a chance to see who the live band was that night but there was a good sized crowd for them (I left before they started). The highlight of my night was a guy from Boston that came up to me and my friend telling me how great Boston sports teams are. Being a S.F. native I countered his argument with the late 80's bay area sports teams. Niners back to back superbowls, A's 3 world series appearances in a row, Bay Bridge series and the Warriors Run TMC wasn't all that bad either. After I divulged that information on him he said you're good and then went back to his friends. Shortly after we left and continued our rampage through north beach.

oVi93-7sKCosSxj5b5KzMQ.review_text: Not to bad.  I somehow always meet people when i go here.  I like to start off here and move on because the place can get a little packed and a little warm.  Cool atmosphere, good beers on tap, and almost always a good jam band playing.  My only problem is the bouncers always give me crap about my I.D. cause its from forever ago and out of state.  I guess its reason enough to get a new one.

mveiiXTA_CU8RsSKAZZx5g.review_text: Post college crowd the night I went.  Perfectly fine band, tall, handsome all-American boys standing around holding beers.  I'm nearing 50 and went with a younger work colleage.  I liked the band and did not feel uncomfortable here - except the bathroom scene seemed a little odd.  It was a unisex bathroom with a door that did not seem to lock, so take someone with you to guard the door.

a8N9dAsIZHQNKZZZehRACg.review_text: considering the location, this bar is a winner in my book. free live music, comedy and cheap drinks. and they have $3 absinthe shots during happy hour - which runs pretty late btw. don't take a date here, unless you have a GREAT date.

M_SxfmZjepJYxE_vNbWK4g.review_text: Friday- Me:       "Look, they're playing 80's covers!!!" Annie:  "Niice, let's check it out!"  Saturday- Me:       "Hey, there's a reggae band in there!!!" Annie:  "Sweet, let's go in! I love reggae!"  Sunday- Annie:  "Let's check out what's goin on at Grant and Green!" Me:       "Grant and Green?!  OK!!!"  One month later- Jeanie: "This is your new favorite place, Annie?!? It stinks in here!"  Annie:   "That's just cuz it's your first time!"  Minus one star for the initiatory stink!

7Ud5MkgdBb9iZJlmPKsAKw.review_text: Fun, classic North Beach bar-hopping stop. No cover, live music, decently-priced drinks. Think: girls in jeans and a scrubby-ish going-out top; guys in T-shirts, jeans and a scrub hat.   Pros: Good, live music, with plenty of space to dance. Cheap-ish drinks. Friendly, accepting atmosphere, with cool bartenders. Cool "dive bar" feel without that "get-me-out-of-this-sketchy-place" aftertaste.  Cons: When there's dancing, there is NO ventilation, and this place gets brutally hot and sweaty. Seriously, it's like being in an uncomfortable, dark, drunken sauna.  Bottom line: Fun place for a laid-back evening ou, but check out the music lineup first-- that will make-or-break your experience depending on what you're looking for.

Ct456aEICzDfn03MHZCzsw.review_text: Many years ago someone set me up w. a BLIND date; he was sooo ugly I suggested that we go to Grant & Green for some dancing and I was a little happier getting a few drinks, dancing in the dark and barely seeing that pudgy mug he had. Bad lighting works for BLIND date scares.

7ccuuvYz9PAUMZ-2VVBZZw.review_text: Pabst in cans? Automatic 4 stars. Add a little snake juice, Giant's baseball, some Marshall Law, you have a recipe for the perfect local bar. It can get loud once the live music starts, so if you're looking to chill...this is probably not your best bet. Don't let the Snake Juice (ask for it by name) go to your head, mix it up with the local toughguys, and see what happens. Personally I love this place, I feel really comforatble with the diverse crowd...My girl feels comfortable with the crowd as well (she takes shots of snake juice, what a hottie!). Usually a great getaway from the usual bar scenes around town. Good down-to-earth fun. Tell Manny that I sent you.

cMICirZm69WlJHyasuUPTg.review_text: I lived just a block away from this place a few months ago, and we would stop here frequently before cruzin around the rest of north beach. They always have some type of live music and on a friday or saturday the place is usually pretty crowded. It's pretty small and hardly anywhere to sit. Every time I have been here it's taken a while to even get a drink. The crowd is a little mixed depending on the music which is good, but I don't think I would spend my whole night here, it's a convient place to stop for a drink but that's about it.

JQ472bHDvtNQLTKVzuswcw.review_text: Great atmosphere and awesome live reggae band. Gonna have to be my newest staple in San Fran. Silly place to meet people, friends, and arch-nemeses.

QuZbJquRtbY9O9JrB9NpxQ.review_text: Run-on review again but it befits the evening when I dropped in here:  I'm calling this a solid dive-bar that I would return to without hesitation despite the allegations of a rougher crowd from other yelpers because I had the start of a great evening here and the bartender was friendly and down to earth and the drinks were reasonable and they have good happy hour prices...

QcPN-Dee_dU2IWno-f2oYA.review_text: It was a slow night last night because it was Thanksgiving, but the owner was hanging out there (or atleast he said he was the owner, i was a couple drinks down, he may have just been trying to impress me).  this is the type of place I call a bar's-type bar. yeah.

XddPpqgbKUqcmHh05r__-Q.review_text: Hole in the wall saloon style place with way too much ghetto music. I mean this is North Beach, not East Oakland. Ohh and mouthy loud blonde wench behind the bar...."STFU!" Being a bartender is about your customers not about you.

a3HRx4lm61ju3V9EIaCX6Q.review_text: This place sucks.  I thought it was the bouncers who were being non-sensical jerks by turning away cover-PAYING guests because the place was "to full" even though the entire second room (where my friend's band was playing) was empty.  But actually, they were just acting on the instructions of the owner, who called the cops when I asked him why he was denying entry.  Ok, maybe he called the cops because I called him a cocksucker, but still, denying entry, thereby reducing the bar and the band's take of the door, is just plain lame.  I wish I could give it zero stars.

3cnIyELXdZa9C9nFH5NXtg.review_text: There is one reason to come here, drinks are cheap!  I don't if it was a special or something, but I was getting $4 Jameson Rocks all night! WTH??? $4???  Mind blown!    The bar itself is a dive.  I gets super crowded ($4????).  It had a live cover band on Saturday night, and I am assuming other nights as well.  Oh and it has a pool table.    I'll come again ($4????????)!

RqUJo6tjD8m4JEuZ37VN5g.review_text: i came here on a wednesday night and it was pretty dead.  the loud hiphop seemed incongruous in relation to the dark pub feel, and all the cheap beers are served in cans (i hate cans).

woW3EEoyj5M42Z7yXLhNLg.review_text: Let me preface this review by stating a disclaimer that not ALL of my reviews are going to contain a story wherein I am liquored up and ridiculous. That said, this one does.  My introduction to Grant and Green was during the North Beach Festival, where thousands of people (most of whom wish they were still in college) relish the opportunity to drink during the daytime and still adhere to socially acceptable standards. These people wake up thinking, "Today, I am going to PUNISH my liver. And it is going to be the tits, because everyone else is a-floatin' in the same boat!" Clearly, these are my brethren.   So I'm with my girls, and we're bar hopping, making our way over to the beer gardens, when we come upon this divey looking place with a sign that says, "NORTH BEACH FESTIVAL SPECIAL: JACK DANIELS SHOTS" and I'm like, "Ladies... pit stop." I make quick friends with Ben the doorman, who's impressed with my ability to slam the whiskey like its the Sweet Nectar of Life and therefore does not charge me. We move onto the beer gardens, followed by the concert in the park (Unauthorized Rolling Stones- fucking UNREAL., fyi).  After the face-melting rock of the 'Stones cover band, I felt a twinge in my soul, like, something was amiss. The problem? The Jack Tingle (that's what I call my whisky buzz) was fading fast. So I confer with the gang, and it is decided that a return trip to Grant and Green is in order. Back we go, and before you know it I've regained my stride and power through the rest of the afternoon, befriending G&G all-stars such as bartenders Zak and Blaze, and the neighborhood drunkard Perry (whom I had to inform that I was not, in fact, employed by Centerfolds, much to his dismay).  By the end of my evening, I had lost my (roommates) sweater, my sunglasses, and my ability to stand or reason. This place kicks ass.

7vs_NdEgeZh8Lp5AR8z9fw.review_text: I wanted to go see the Spazmatics play at  this venue.  I was more excited to see the band play than going to the actual bar and rightly so.  The place was indeed kinda seedy and grungy but I have to admit it wasn't a bad place to go see a band play.  I had a Corona when I first got there and they served it with a bottle and lime and later in the night when I ordered another Corona they gave it to me in a can WTF?!  Seriously, who wants to drink a Corona in a can with no lime?  The band played and they were fairly good.  Everyone was dancing.  There were a few obnoxious people dancing on the dance floor. Unfortunately one of those obnxious people was one person from our party. I wanted to smack him so bad.  Good thing he's NO FRIEND of mine. He just came along with my sister's boyfriend.  But this venue seriously needs to think about investing in industrial fans. It was so freaking hot in there that I was showering in my own sweat.  Sooo gross.  They really needed more powerful fans breeze out the room.  Even the perfomers on stage were drenched in their own sweat.  Not a bad place to go but I wouldn't rave about it.  If a good band plays, I'll go but I won't frequent the bar on a regular basis or anything.

w85ExtcWtZv2tZ35NxN9LA.review_text: Reasonably priced and bonus points for supporting local bands.  Beers were $5 and hard liquor was $6.  I explained to the bartender that Zwack is known at Unicum in Hungary.  It's like Jager, but less crappy.  The downsides... it gets really warm inside and parking's impossible (like most of North Beach).

pBNqvV5IkldL24s418ZzRw.review_text: i like this place... it wasn't overly crowded, played good music, i think they had a live band but they were finished by the time we got there... but it seems like a good venue for some intimate live shows. The bartenders were nice. But the bathroom situation is a little weird. two bathrooms position in the middle of the bar for unisex use... can get a little dirty and a little awkward and a little intense. but other than that the experience was A OK!

GCuDiPUKYxhgFHP5LqJa2Q.review_text: No coverage for live music - some good bands too.  Last night, we were there for a Tom Petty cover band, good times.  They had a $3 orange Patron special.  Entrepreneur, Scott, is super cool and friendly - lots of fun too.   No frills, a solid bar w/ live music - what more can you ask for?

rtd4t1APKJCWlZkZZry5Jg.review_text: I can only comment on their 2nd Wednesday of the month when they have an awesome 9 piece reggae band play.
