I haven't hung out much in North Beach so I am not sure of the normal vibe. I guess I would describe it as Marina type dudes, except skinny and non-douchy. So like a non-fat bro with a side of cracker.  Oh and here you also get drunk moms getting down on the dance floor. Eclectic mix  of people. I like it. The bouncer is way nice and fun.

fy9_Fneu9b55iLSRk3YjYw.review_text: Nice bartenders. Good venue for live music.  This place never quite seems to get too packed...which is great when you just want to hang out and talk, but not so good when you're looking for a social bar scene. The plus about this place is that the venue is PERFECT for live music. There is ample space to rest your beer or (as I prefer) cocktail, kick back, and enjoy good live music.   Grant and Green also introduced me to this amazing man that I had never heard of before...Sailor Jerry. $3 sailor jerry's are always on the menu and since Captain Morgan and I had a nice little fling in college, I thought I'd take it back and do some reminiscing.   Ok, so Sailor Jerry isn't THAT amazing, but it's $3 here. Can't  beat that!

_wBPDOEC4T1dVcCaDC7k6Q.review_text: Grant and Green needs to seriously invest in air conditioning. I'm a dancer and have been here three times to see a friend's band. Every time I've felt ill and have sweated buckets because they have no air circulation. While the bartenders are cool and pour great drinks, it's impossible to stay in here for more than an hour without experiencing heat exhaustion. Truly an over sight by management.

vULXoRV8SBw6Lx2VdnMaFA.review_text: I met a couple people early in the evening around 8:30 on a Saturday night.  Like any other bar at that hour, things were quiet.  The scene at Grant & Green started to pick up once the bands began playing.  The two bands, Just Off Turner and 5 A.M., were surprisingly good rock bands--props to whoever booked them.  The crowd was young, hip-looking, and fun.  At the bar, the bartenders were friendly and quick.  In addition, the draft beer selection was standard bar fare and moderately  priced at $5 per pint (at least for Stella Artois).  Overall, great place to begin a night out in the North Beach area.

D01KrKs9izEdoT0Eh4i4rQ.review_text: This place is okay.  The place does have live bands, but it gets pretty loud.  It's not a place where I would recommend friends to go to.

LXQLTfi2p6ZFEodfW3MyMg.review_text: I really enjoy Grant and Green for live music! We were here the other night for my friend's band. They have a raised stage, so it is easy to see (even for us shorties). The service was quick and friendly. I would definitely classify this as more of a dive bar, but that is my favorite type. They served me red wine in a pint glass :)  The prices were on the lower-end for SF, but it is cash only. The only other thing that I can say about it is that it was extremely hot inside. But overall, I will definitely be back to check out some live music.

jX52sZoojxyYV2viWNyO7A.review_text: For its prime location at the heart of North Beach, the Grant & Green did not leave an indelible impression on me.  In fact, I only vaguely recall the decor on the interior.  I seem to recall talking to serious barflies and getting myself rather faded.  Still, with so little to recall, I probably won't go back.  When you have Amante, O'Reilly's, the Saloon, Northstar, and the Savoy within a couple of blocks, why even come in here?

82dCHyU-ANOgdhxUgZsUeg.review_text: The only thing I like about this place is the name. You might be thinking you're stumbling into a British bar like in the movie Green Street Hooligans, but you're not. It's sort of a "bro place" or one of those places where white girls come in and shout how drunk they are.  I did, however, have a decent time. They had a pool table that I was occupied with for a while. Space is a little limited so watch where the butt of the pool cue goes. I somewhat enjoyed my corporate tasting beer and was on my way to another joint in North Beach.  I say only come here if every other place is full--definitely not a place to go out of your way for. It's one of those, "well it's just right there," places.

7p5nTW9Tpw_3VDC4vuLSBQ.review_text: Great dive bar, the ambiance is great, the music is awesome, had a great time there.

ctr_BlCf3Ogny-vLs8E9tQ.review_text: +1 star for having jazz on Monday night.

C0el0SuXLmzMzlPbUdSozg.review_text: It was fine. Dark, not overly friendly but they had a decent selection of beer and a good location. It is cash only and the drafts were $5.

MU_bppwgP03jfpTo6vtZ5w.review_text: A place i rarely frequent... Its rather small.. And for whatever reason trouble makers seem drawn here... And the crowd is fairly young when it gets busy.. Nit a place to watch sports- but for me that only matters during football..  There really isnt anything that you can really say about  this bar..  BUT:  AWESOME bartenders. cool bouncers  Great music.   Yep thats about it.

0aEsYrwrBHE4LRgvv-A2yg.review_text: Live music, beer, and cool peeps. Could you really ask for more?  Well, yes... but... that's not the point.  Cool joint!

K9E4zQSmE9KguCxCQZ42Kg.review_text: Loved this place! Awesome band on Saturday night and strong drinks. Good service. Fun with a big group.

_whidoIrsFdn3tWYVXY_zA.review_text: if you like to get constantly hit on by all types of men that do not equal attractive, come here. i love it when a man tries to hit on you and you turn them down and then they get pissed at you. turns me on.  "oh, wait...is that your boyfriend over there?" "yeah." "FIGURES!" hits the table and goes into the one person bathroom with his wingman.

24pirQC_JSQ-UunYOV5-6Q.review_text: they get 2 stars - one just for even having a bottle of Pimm's in the place and the second because my friend's coworker was playing with his band this one night. that's it. They didn't know how to make a Pimm's cup, and decided it was just better to pour all that was left in the bottle in my glass rather than measure. That's fine, and really shame on me for expecting more. Go here if you have a real reason and for beer. Just beer. Nothing more. They do allow outside food, but since the inside of the toilets is visible to everyone in the place, I don't know how much I'd want to eat here. P.S. It's not even cheap for a divey bar!

J7ka23aCUNK-v_yLB4AL1Q.review_text: Two things I noticed (and hate) as I walked through the door; a fat CASH ONLY sign, and the overwhelming stench of vomit.   After paying the outrageous $3.50 fee at the in-house ATM, I ordered up a drink and chugged it down quick, I sure as hell didn't want to stay. The smell seemed to only get worse.   Plain Jane in the way of decor, pretty large quarters, friendly bartenders, lively patrons, and a band(they were setting up). The place has the makings of a good bar except for that god awful smell.   Hole number 5 seemed to be a bust, stupid sand traps! I think I'll take a mulligan next round of pub golf when this is one of our stops.

puvyO8VZP0RqQCvZVMVKjg.review_text: Say what you will about North Beach - I get it, and for the most part, I'm right there with you - but Grant & Green is a great bar. It all starts with who mans the drinks, and I don't think G & G knows how to hire bad staff. Everyone who works here is friendly, and so far, I've yet to receive a bad pour. It's also a great place to catch random live bands and comedy, and even play a little beer pong. If you're looking for a bar in the area where you can come as you are, have a beer, and maybe even hear some live music, this is the spot.

cCkfbokqyh6XKlodFMiOSA.review_text: Some good bars in town but this one is kind of the best I think cause there service is so good.  For alot of reasons in the end..  Its got a good FULL bar and lots of TV to. Saw some live music but NO COVER haha sick !! Dudes were shredding one time..  Anyhow you could try this bar to relax after work or bring some buds and watch the games.  Coming back here soon and you could to on a Friday maybe..  GO SHARKS !!

4OrFB2TDRsbokoYMhUf1EA.review_text: 3/12 stars it got a grunge look to it and the live bands are great not really spacious but the drinks are made well, bartenders are always smiling  alcohol **** yes they make snakebites if pear cider is stocked price $ its the city so moderate price ambiance*** dark, small

YdwAL-io8Siha9C4-Xe5qQ.review_text: Update- they added $10 to my tab without my consent. If I could give 0 stars I would  Had a great night after the giants won WS3. My buddy invited me to play drums with his funk band about a week before. After about ten shots and 5 beers with my two homies I brought to the bar, this bartender told me to quit and pay. I had only 3 shots and a beer but totalled a $100 tab. So dude makes me pay my tab, I tip him 15% (fair=$1 tip per drink) and he says "thanks for the tip a-hole". One of my buddies responds "f..u" in a n incredulous way. Dude says "I've been pouring this @ss drinks all night" and kicks us out. We werent even there for 2 hours and couldn't understand why this dude would cut us off. I didnt even get to play music, but luckily my homey had an extra drummer for the night.  Had to leave my $3000 drum kit in a bar that kicked me out. Talk about an a-hole!  Would have given one star, but I did have fun. So.... F** it!

R2p221627ZK5IhFBVI0OzQ.review_text: I go here once in a while because it's near work and sometimes friends play shows there. That's really all I have to say about the place. Normal kinda dirty bar with kinda okay people hanging around.

bWTIMv6FKnkOEfxw7yR5jw.review_text: Went to see a little band here last weekend with some friends.  The band was cool, but good lord it was hot in there!  Felt like 110 degrees.   The drinks, service and locations were all "ok".

qoYZ6QbVczMo3Dtyaeubhg.review_text: It just feels out of place for me.  Why is it in NB? Because of it, you have tons of randoms walking in, looking around, and leaving. It's a little too small as well.  Ok place to start out your night though and cheaper than most places in NB.

cLQ-p5iXbo5KPCus8mKWWg.review_text: This is my favorite North Beach bar. There is no cover and there are always bands playing. It's very small and there are only two bathrooms which can be quite smelly at times but what bars in SF aren't small with smelly bathrooms?? The drinks are always generously poured and I don't think they are overpriced at all. There's a huge pool table, although I think they should move it out of the way because it takes up dancing space. People here are always friendly and it's a safe area. We always walk around and go bar hopping and eat dinner and then end up back here at the end of the night. Plus there's a parking garage just off Columbus that's easy to walk to and from if you can't find street parking.

aS8mvg6EYBQrPp7n36MUOw.review_text: If you're in North Beach, this is definitely a bar to hit up. It's always a safe decision to go to Grant & Green, there's always a good time to be had.  Bartenders never ignore you. I've never waited longer than 3 minutes for a drink, and this place is always packed. They always have live music on the weekend. I'm pretty sure I've never been when they didn't have a live band.   And it's always nice when there aren't a ton of douchebags parading around a bar...I mean this is North Beach, there are a lot of them, but Grant & Green doesn't attract them! Definite solid choice for a good night out.

8_APo4b5Y2lDlP681zvROA.review_text: Your classic dive bar with live bands. Nothing special and nothing fancy. It's great place to watch the game on a weekday. During weekend nights, it's pretty much too loud to even think or breathe since it get way crowded. I guess you really shouldn't be going to this bar to watch a game anyway. I've never had a cocktail here so I can't say much about that but the bartenders are nice enough when pouring me a beer. The only awkward thing is that the restrooms are right in the middle of everything so that when you walk out, not only do you shine everyone's faces with a bright fluorescent light but you may also be sharing other things that "tickles" their senses.

lHCYr_k28hOxuALsUDxAVw.review_text: I realized I needed to update my review here.  My issues with it are still the same (a little expensive, out of the way, etc), BUT, they are currently (as far as I know) the only dive bar in the city that still offers Local Music on a regular basis at no cover to the patrons and actually pays the bands.  The booking agent gets back to you, the bartenders are super nice to the bands, and as long as you show up, bring a few people, and stay the night, they'll give you a little cash for the effort.  While this seems like it should be standard, this is unfortunately a rarity in San Francisco, so I feel they deserve at least an extra star for keeping it real and giving musicians a place to perform without giving them a holier-than-thou attitude b/c they run a bar.

Fk2S8UCP2lL_qn7UQJwCHA.review_text: No cover for this place...went here because of a friends b-day. The music was ok but they don't accept credit cards which really pissed me off! What kind of bar doesn't accept credit cards??

xA9nf-8PYbXT8qw8Q-5BBw.review_text: The bartender gave me and my friend free beers as soon as we walked in, for no apparent reason. That rocked my socks that night, because stuff like that never happens to "Ugly Betty" types like me.   This place would've been a blasty-blast if I had been there with a group of friends, but it was a bit lonely, loud, and obnoxious with just 2 people. It was "band nerd" night, and everyone there was definitely the grown up high school drum major type - super dorky, yet super fun.   Definitely NOT a place to pick up men, at least not in my book, but a fun divey place to throw back a few canned beers with friends.

enQQMC0gI942FaPe9Gz9qA.review_text: I like dives, I really do, so based on the descriptions I thought I'd like Grant and Green...I was wrong. When I think dive I think dark, dingy, big booths/tables to hang out with friends, bad music on the jukebox, strong/cheap drinks, and maybe some regulars and/or old men sipping straight drinks at the bar. This place had two of those elements: dark and dingy. The music was VERY loud live jazz; we couldn't talk and we all had headaches by the end. There were just a bunch of uncomfortable tables so we all had sore asses too. Getting Corona in a can did remind me of being in Puerto Vallarta for my senior trip but I am not sure if that is a good thing...

BHDBfx4mWOdtT-ug0CPc3w.review_text: Live music, fun atmosphere, and next door to Maggies. :) The drinks are ALWAYS strong, and the bartenders are efficient and entertaining. It is cash only, & they do have a ATM as well.

EjTY2XV-vlgz3428S_vpGQ.review_text: Went here after we went to North Beach Pizza and then had a drink at the Saloon. This is a decent bar, good drink selection and you don't have to pay a cover. I think they usually have live music every night. Good place to have a drink or two.  This is a cash only bar! My Vodka/Cranberry was $5 and bottles of beer are $6.

dP2vQRFB0xK5bD-aCGZM1w.review_text: small neighborhood joint. there's a stage that caters to live bands. i actually came here to watch some friends perform. jahlectrik...check them out! decent amount of people there on a tuesday night. not really a bar thats in my hood but definitely a chill spot to kick it if you're in the area.

6T4-k_9b0TspalSoxHZ1cQ.review_text: I've been here a few times, but thought the bartender working last fri was a dbag.  Other than that, music and crowd were ok.

qBxWEFQwCFkx0xnRGw9R8Q.review_text: Although there have already been several people who have commented about the cancellation of music at Grant & Green, I am compelled to comment as well.  I hauled ass all the way from the East Bay to come to a venue I would not normally frequent (sorry not into collar popping trying to relive their formidable college drinking binges) to see a friend's band play. I roll up a bit late, to find all my friends milling around the corner outside the bar. There is no tale tell sound of a live band spilling onto the street and every one seems a bit miffed. I am then immediately informed that the show has been canceled due to the pressing need to host a beer pong competition.  It is within every right for the manger of the bar to cancel a show where at least 20 people showed up specificity for in sake of his friends getting together to throw sweaty balls into glasses of lukewarm beer. Right....  Overall, I am disappointed with the venue and the behavior of the staff there. I would not go there again or bother spending my hard earned money on a crappy Bud Lite. Instead go somewhere that values the ambiance of live music and good staff.

J5J0v-WShT2NwhTRIM5SnQ.review_text: 3.5 stars So this was the first place I went to when visiting SF this last weekend. We were meeting some friends for a little surprise birthday celebration and I had no idea what we were getting in to.The moment I walked in I thought to myself "uhhhhh what a dive". But after I sat back, relaxed and took it ALL in I actually kind of liked this place.  What an eclectic group of people that pass through the G&G. Cheap drinks, fun to people watch, socialize (if you aren't the pretentious type) and the DJ was actually pretty good. He had this little dive going off. I would go back, probably not make a special trip here but wouldnt pass it up. I can see why people would enjoy Grant and green.

aJCjOAGLAsA4vJ26Mc99tg.review_text: Been there a few times. Usually a decent band is playing. the place is a little seedy but it does the job.  Mickey's Grenades for $2 aren't bad either.  Ended up dancing with this Cougar for a while.  She offered to rock my world. I declined. Still have her number in my phone as "Cougar" though....

rATb3uJZEKCLrB1G1c6K6w.review_text: dare i say this was one of the best gigs we've played?  this place is awesome.  great booze, friendly staff, good tunes, good times.  the only thing that could make it better is if they had a sound guy.

UQFE3BT1rsIYrcDvu_XVow.review_text: Bring your friends, listen to a band you've never head and probably never will hear again, and enjoy the strongest mixed drinks this side of columbus street.  If that ACDC cover band comes back, somebody please let me know.  Not very swank, but just clean enough that you feel sane leaving your jacket behind the bar.

iI5hC_uNUBGkkvtWrBIaZQ.review_text: Cool little saloon to have a few drinks at.  There was a live band playing... they were the dorkiest wannabe rockstars ever, but I guess it worked.  The best thing about the place is the decor on the outside.  You definitely do not need to wonder what street you need to tell your cab driver to drop you off at and you can't miss good ol' Ulysses outside.  It feels like you're walking into a $50 bill.  I'll definitely come back here again when I'm in the area.

lFpEKQtS6NjvJqy-7Rujug.review_text: Wouldn't go so far to call this place a "dive bar," if for any other reason, there's not a real sense of "local joint to grab some drinks with some regulars from the neighborhood."   Like a lot of places in North Beach, there's always a constant stream of out-of-towners (or out-of-North-Beachers) coming and going, peeking through the window to size the place up, etc.  It's hard to say what this place is...but whatever it is, it's not good. The vibe is weird, the music is way too loud, and the street is filled with too many packs of dudes on the prowl for booty or a brawl. Bottom line: It's just hard to get behind the G&G.

DJg5gdqoXOKYdkkVBUpYTA.review_text: This bar definitely needs more than a single door guy.  Two entrances and too many violent drunk knuckleheads  in bathroom lines.

J4a_ehsnuV8FVRP06K3FPg.review_text: Popped in to kill some time & watch a little college basketball on a late Saturday afternoon.  The bar is your typical dingy lighted place with your run-of-the-mill well drinks.  At night there are bands playing, the music is varied (according to the bartender).  The low point of the establishment - Bathrooms are not the greatest. if you just want a spot to hang with your friends, be prepared to do it standing because seating is limited. Service was good, not great.  Bartender was nice & pleasant.   Bar was not expensive.    In the end, G&GS is what you would expect.

vkcjE5hyiXoVVTX8fOJ0iQ.review_text: Shockingly poor service.  Came in last night to get a drink, and the bartender was at the other end of the bar talking to a buddy.  Waited about 15 minutes for him to finish the conversation.  No dice.  So walked over to get his attention and see if I could get a beer.  His response "I'll get you your drink when I have finished the conversation with my buddy."  I am not joking.  Can't say I've ever experienced that before - not even in college.  Many of my friends go to this bar and give them good business.  I called every last one of them and told them what happened, and we all decided to boycott the place.    Giving customer service like that - in this economy - is just not very bright.

gKYIL_QxKExmYSLReo2stA.review_text: a very lackluster bar. it has no character, whatsoever: it's not big. it's not small. it's not light. it's not dark. nothing special as far as decor goes. it's basically just... there.   it's name well reflects it's lack of ingenuity.  i had some cheap beer for a happy hour special, but that's about it.   boring.

eXt9426w2kE65rUMhKb4Cg.review_text: Corona in a CAN?  WTF mate?  Beer selection is mediocre, and priced high for the selection.  It smells like vomit in there ALL THE TIME!  Bartenders are a bit brusque.  And the bouncers tolerate NOTHING!  No shinanogans?  WTF MATE?

oOlAlkWjrMZgcURILE72MA.review_text: Your quintessential SF divey bar with a great vibe!  Jukebox, pool table, good drinks, cool bartenders---what more do you need. Trevor the manager keeps things rolling and is a great host (ok, he happens to be cure too..)  Check is out if you've never been in!

42evZux7BN7cIO-rdB-X7w.review_text: I mostly go to Grant and Green right after work when its slow and the crazy neighborhood beggers, drunks, and/or methheads provide entertainment outside.  Good local hangout and the prices are about the same as anywhere around here.  Live music everynight is a big plus..... And.... Want to kill some brain cells with friends on a weekend afternoon?  Go to Grant and Green and enjoy their "Regulation Beer Pong" tables.  I hadn't played beer pong since I was 18! What a blast!!!

LwJuBvnmCPWxyaCVO6L_PA.review_text: It can be AWESOME or just SOOO lame...I have had some insane nights at G & G.  Take a chance.on a Fri night and grab a beer at G & G. They sometimes have some really fun bands...

p-rz5nElTuSyUV1Dzui6Yg.review_text: Hire a band, then schedule a beer pong tournament and tell the band not to play. What's more astounding is the drunken frat boys and their underage girlfriends for some reason not wanting to get drunk while listening to great funky tunes.   Hmmm. This had to be the worst, rudest crowd I have ever been in contact with. It must be from drinking the shit off the floor from bouncing a ball on the dirty mucky floor and then drinking it. Must make you mental.   Guess the manager didn't want to make any money. I know everyone who came to see the band left. The wine there sucks and the drinks are just expensive for the rude service.   I used to like coming here. Now I just won't. I say boycott them.

jnmczPEkhRsUFos_nBPjTA.review_text: Grant & Green is so close to my place, but in 3 years living here I have been there only twice. This is about to change. Why? The super cool live jazz on Monday nights.  This past Monday I was invited to go check out the jazz band that has been playing at G&G for over a year. Big Michael leads the band and supports different musicians who come by and take turns. The small crowd consisted of other musicians and the few locals that know about this lovely opportunity to enjoy good live jazz played by people that are very passionate about their craft. I had such a great time with my super enthusiastic companion and the fun energy of the musicians that I am already looking forward to coming back for more jazz!

15znE0NM6nDU2oR-i5RXVA.review_text: When I first moved to the city, I asked the cab driver to take me someplace fun and mellow. He first dropped me off at Columbus Cafe...excellent, well done driver then after a drink or two I mosed up to this place. There was a chick on stage that looked just like Yoko Ono (Sp?) The crowd was really mellow and just enjoying the music. It was a Tuesday night (I was still unemployed) I was WASTED! Before I knew it, I had myself, my friend, and three random guys back at my house drinking beers and having a dance party till the wee hours... Needless to say, this bar pours a stiff drink, draws a fun crowd and makes me do stupid shit...I like it.

eUmVXP9UnoWtz9NSBwY4jA.review_text: A decent venue to see live music if you don't mind dropping 10 pounds in the course of the evening from the oppressive temperature inside the bar. Also, beer prices are pretty outrageous - think $5 for a bottle of Red Stripe or a pint of Fat Tire. No cover, though, and for a somewhat dive bar they have surprisingly good sound.

XXfnk1Y5TBuKhjDNwjinRQ.review_text: Grant and Green on the surface appears to be a great place. Friendly neighborhood bar with live music. However, if you looked up the word "douchebag" in the dictionary, you would see a picture of the bald bartender that works here.   Overcharged my friend about $15 for 3 drinks he ordered. Pretty much belittled another friend I was with. Had no respect for the girls in our party...I could go on. Be sure and check your tab if you order from this joker.   Gets 2 stars for the music.

WnzRueYdRWNSbkXB0_0i4Q.review_text: My fav North Beach bar (well tied with Northstar Cafe).  Opens 2pm to 2am daily and the bartenders are always awesome. 2 for $5 well / beer / mix and match drinks too! $3 shots of Sailor Jerry rum all day, SOLD!  $1 pinball and $1 pool is also lots of fun. I'll be back, love this dive bar.

rk5nGYpTYKDvTJB4HfRFyQ.review_text: There are a few things I dread more than going to North Beach on the weekends.  Something really awful happened in the few years I took a break from the bay area.  But we went to see a friend's band play here last weekend and I enjoyed a great drunken, asshole free night in North Beach at Grant & Green for many hours. It was great to have too fun sublimish bands for free.   Funny enough, the north beach weekend was apparently still going on outside since a guy got knocked down in fight quicker than I'd ever seen in one of my cigarette breaks.

zPB_8G-kuA9hb-MPdXaRkA.review_text: To the people who are assuming half of your drink money goes to the "shitty cover band" I'm here to tell you, as a member of a shitty cover band that played this place, we don't get squat.  Me and 8 other musicians played for nearly 5 hours, brought over twenty of our own friends into the place, got people dancing on the floor and the bartender gave us 100 to split 8 ways.  Plus we got ONE free drink each.  Don't hate the bands.  All in all a nice enough place.  Drinks are a little expensive for a weeknight.  The bartender was nice and attentive.  As a side note, you may want to bring brass knuckles or a switchblade to this place, my friend's face is broken because 7 muggers hit him out in the street in front of the building.

fQl9-OzXtisnX9l9P6A2bQ.review_text: Grant and Green is located on the corner of Grant and Green in North Beach.  There is no cover and the drinks are cheap.  Grant and Green regularly showcases live music, accommodating at least a five piece band on a small stage.  Patrons can dance and drink in an intimate setting.  If hunger strikes, head over to nearby Golden Boy Pizza for a quick slice of delicious pizza at an affordable price.

WUOURRbJhrPAKUA5pOAZEw.review_text: My old work watering hole.   Check the sign on the side of the building next to the front door. That's where they advertise who's playing when and what the specials are. If you're lucking it will say   $2 FERNET SHOTS  If there was a live band playing, I'd pop in for a handful of Fernet shots to get the ball rolling, and then get the heck outta there (because at the ripe old age of 25, my ears can't handle the loud music anymore.)

_0WAdWO7wNr19wqYYgDfIg.review_text: If you want to listen to music..DO NOT go to Grant and Green to get exercise for your dancing feet because the band may not be allowed to play due to a beer pong tournament going into overtime. Not to mention a beer tournament that the manager is actively participating in and dominating.  This bar is fun for a drunken night of debauchery with your underage and over-glamorized marina girlies but NOT fun if you want to get a cheap beer (really, a pint was $6!!) and listen to some groovy music played by your favorite local band.  I would STRONGLY recommend walking 4 businesses down on the same side of the street to MOJITO'S where the company is festive, the drinks will get you tipsy, the music is funky and there is no chance of the venue canceling on the band. Unheard of!

ZNJiYLz_6udX3ljXPZ9FJg.review_text: Great local pub showcasing great local talents.  It took us a few weeks before we were regularly admitted to all shows without having to pay a cover charge - sometimes, we'd feel special, but most of the time I couldn't help but think that the bouncer was too drunk to remember whether or not people had to pay to get in!   I'd like to think I was special.  I was there often enough and after a while, I didn't even need a drink to head over to Grant & Green - Just give me my Blues, a little dancing space, and I'm good to go!  Seriously, pretty much a dive with your regular locals on the same barstool every night but other great people nonetheless, locals and tourists alike, every night of the week just wanting some soulful Blues.  It's fun just walkin back and forth between here and the Saloon...

jShChcFSVXOIOhuXTNrRvg.review_text: Grant & Green is a solid option in North Beach.  It's a good place to meet up with friends after eating at some of the great restaurants in the area.  I like the big screen TVs that tend to have sports on, and the live music is usually really good.  You can't see the bands from all parts of the bar (e.g. the front portion of the main bar), but in general there is good standing room and it is not overly crowded.   The bartenders have always been friendly and prompt, and tables are always good to congregate around.  They do have a tendency to have the music too loud so that it can be hard to talk to people.

abMIw41Injf2rIMzMRUm7g.review_text: Every time I've gone here, people have bought me drinks, so I don't actually know how much they cost.  I'm not sure why it's been sort of dead every time I've been there (which was about two or three times), but I actually like it quite a bit.  I had my first Stoli tonic here and it was good.  Now that I think about it, it is pretty inconveniently located for me, considering it's in the North Beach area where parking sucks, and I drive a big ass car.  On the bright side though, you can spare yourself the troubles by parking at the nearby garage on Vallejo.  Because of its location and the fact that I used to have a reason to go here before (someone I knew used to DJ here every first Wednesday of the month), I can't actually see myself going back unless I'm in the area, which is very rarely.  It's worth checking out at least once, though.

VCROW1kVZhf1XYzBwQ8B-w.review_text: Grab a beer and watch some sports. The occasional live fusion jazz bands happen to be pretty good, too.

Dz8DrAyYNU-5IzRi1qV1Og.review_text: My number one complaint, why does it always feel like a sauna in there.  It's so stuffy in there that most people have to come out for air at one point of their visit, that's why you see so many people hanging outside of it, well, also because it's so freaking small.  They do have a live band corner which is nice.  Drinks here are decently priced.  They never chill your shot here for you unless you request it. ...
